newsitem.title: UK: Four green rates to devalue on Saturday - HGCA.
newsitem.headline: Four green rates to devalue on Saturday - HGCA.

text.p: The green rates of the mark, Belgian franc, guilder and Austrian schilling will be devalued in the agrimonetary system of the European Union (EU) on Saturday, the UK Home-Grown Cereals Authority (HGCA) said on Friday.

HGCA calculated that the green mark would be devalued to 1.93917 per Ecu from 1.93805, the green Belgian franc to 39.9696 from 39.9502, the green guilder to 2.17598 from 2.17413 and the green schilling to 13.6463 from 13.6364.
The changes were triggered by the strength of sterling and the Irish punt in the grid, both of which are being assessed for a revaluation in January.

Green sterling will on Saturday enter its third of possibly five 10-day confirmation periods to be revalued on January 21 while the punt will start its fourth confirmation to be revalued on January 11, the HGCA said.
Green rates are used to calculate EU farm subsidy payments and intervention prices in national currencies and have no direct impact on currency markets.
